case_title: Syed MUHAMMAD AMIN SHAH vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU & KASHMIR And Another
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondents: AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU & KASHMIR

legal_basis.act: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Civil Servant Act, 1976

facts.retirement_reason: Completion of 25 years of service qualifying for pension and retirement benefits
facts.appellant_claim: Entitled to remain in service for 10 more years

tribunal_findings.order_lawfulness: Impugned order is lawful and made in accordance with the law
tribunal_findings.competent_authority_discretion: Competent authority has discretion to retire civil servants after 25 years of service in the public interest
tribunal_findings.tribunal_limitations: Tribunal cannot question the propriety or public interest determination of the competent authority

judgment_summary.legal_position: Civil servant cannot claim retention in service as a right after completing 25 years of service
judgment_summary.competent_authority_power: Authority can retire civil servants in public interest with pensionary benefits
judgment_summary.tribunal_decision: Appeal dismissed with no order as to costs
